doc.ContractDescription: MASS-RADIUS-LUMINOSITY-ROTATION RELATIONSHIPS FOR M DWARF PLANET-HOSTING STARS IN PREPARATION FOR THE TESS, GAIA AND JWST ERA M DWARF STARS DOMINATE STELLAR POPULATIONS, BUT CURRENT STELLAR EVOLUTIONARY MODELS DO NOT ACCURATELY PREDICT THEIR FUNDAMENTAL PROPERTIES AS WELL AS THEY DO FOR SUN-LIKE STARS, WITH EFFECTS FROM RAPID ROTATION BEING A PROMINENT THEORY FOR THE DISCREPANCIES. THE DISCREPANCIES NEED TO BE RESOLVED SOON: BASED ON STATISTICS FROM NASA'S KEPLER MISSION, NASA'S FUTURE TESS MISSION WILL DISCOVER HUNDREDS IF NOT THOUSANDS OF TRANSITING TERRESTRIAL EXOPLANETS ORBITING NEARBY M DWARFS. ESA'S GAIA MISSION WILL PROVIDE PARALLAXES AND CORRESPONDING ABSOLUTE MAGNITUDES FOR THE TESS M DWARF TARGETS. IT IS CRITICALLY IMPORTANT TO DEVELOP ACCURATE AND PRECISE MASSRADIUS - LUMINOSITY - ROTATION RELATIONSHIPS FOR M DWARFS IN PREPARATION FOR TESS AND GAIA, SINCE ACCURATE RELATIONSHIPS ARE REQUIRED TO DETERMINE THE RADII AND EQUILIBRIUM TEMPERATURES OF TESS'S EXOPLANET DISCOVERIES TO HIGH PRECISION. IN THE FUTURE, NASA'S JWST MISSION WILL BE ABLE TO MEASURE THE ATMOSPHERIC CONSTITUENTS OF TERRESTRIAL PLANETS THAT TRANSIT M DWARFS, BUT AT A SIGNIFICANT COST IN TELESCOPE TIME. THEREFORE, THE JWST TARGETS MUST BE CHOSEN CAREFULLY FROM TESS'S DISCOVERIES, AND THEY REQUIRE THE BEST POSSIBLE KNOWLEDGE OF THE EXOPLANETS' RADII AND EQUILIBRIUM TEMPERATURES, WHICH IN TURN REQUIRES THE BEST POSSIBLE KNOWLEDGE OF THEIR M DWARF HOST STARS. WE PROPOSE TO CONDUCT A THREE-YEAR, MULTI-TELESCOPE OBSERVING CAMPAIGN TO MEASURE MASSES, RADII, DISTANCES, AND INDIVIDUAL INFRARED MAGNITUDES OF 40 NEW M DWARF ECLIPSING BINARIES DISCOVERED BY THE INVESTIGATORS IN ARCHIVAL KEPLER DATA. THE CATALOG NEARLY TRIPLES THE NUMBER OF M DWARF ECLIPSING BINARIES KNOWN TO DATE. BY COMBINING ULTRA-PRECISE PUBLICLY-AVAILABLE ARCHIVAL KEPLER PHOTOMETRY, DOUBLE-LINED SPECTROSCOPIC RADIAL VELOCITY MEASUREMENTS, ADAPTIVE OPTICS IMAGING, PARALLAX OBSERVATIONS, AND INFRARED ECLIPSE OBSERVATIONS, WE WILL MEASURE THE MASSES, RADII, DISTANCES AND INDIVIDUAL ABSOLUTE INFRARED MAGNITUDES FOR THE INDIVIDUAL COMPONENTS OF THE M-DWARF BINARY STARS WITH UNPRECEDENTED ACCURACY AND PRECISION. THE INVESTIGATORS WILL USE THE MEASUREMENTS TO CREATE NEW, EMPIRICAL MASS-RADIUS-LUMINOSITY-ROTATION RELATIONSHIPS FOR M DWARFS. THESE RELATIONSHIPS WILL SETTLE LONG-STANDING CONTROVERSIES OVER THE ROLE OF ROTATION AND MAGNETIC ACTIVITY ON M DWARF PROPERTIES. THE RELATIONSHIPS WILL BE USED TO DETERMINE THE RADII AND EQUILIBRIUM TEMPERATURES OF NEARBY TERRESTRIAL EXOPLANETS THAT TRANSIT M DWARFS AS DISCOVERED BY NASA'S TRANSITING EXOPLANET SURVEY SATELLITE (TESS) MISSION, AND TO CHOSE THOSE TARGETS TO STUDY IN DETAIL WITH JWST.
USNS JOSHUA HUMPHREYS, WATER JACKET AND SALT WATER CIRCULATOR REPAIR KITS

THE UPPER IONOSPHERE OF MARS HOLDS CLUES ABOUT THE CLIMATE EVOLUTION AND PAST HABITABILITY OF THE PLANET. THIS REGION INTERACTS WITH THE SOLAR WIND AND IS SUBJECT TO NUMEROUS ESCAPE PROCESSES. THE LOSS RATE OF WATER, A KEY DIAGNOSTIC IN DETERMINING THE EVOLUTION OF THE MARTIAN ATMOSPHERE AND ITS PAST HABITABILITY, IS AFFECTED BY THE UPPER IONOSPHERE AND THESE ESCAPE PROCESSES. LIMITED IN SITU OBSERVATIONS OF THE ATMOSPHERIC, IONOSPHERIC AND FIELD PROPERTIES IN THE UPPER IONOSPHERE HAVE MADE THIS REGION ONE OF THE MOST CHALLENGING TO CHARACTERIZE. OBSERVATIONS OF THE UPPER IONOSPHERE HAVE REVEALED SEVERAL ANOMALOUS FEATURES. ONE OF THE MOST RECURRING ONE IS A BULGE THAT FORMS ABOVE THE MAIN IONOSPHERIC PEAK DUE TO AN ENHANCEMENT OF PLASMA AT TOPSIDE ALTITUDES. VARIATIONS IN PLASMA DENSITY AT THESE ALTITUDES PRODUCE PRESSURE GRADIENTS THAT AFFECT PLASMA TRANSPORT. AS A RESULT, THE RESERVOIR OF PARTICLES AVAILABLE FOR ESCAPE WILL ALSO BE AFFECTED. THE SOURCE OF THESE ENHANCEMENTS HAS BEEN ATTRIBUTED TO SEVERAL THEORETICAL FACTORS; HOWEVER, MODELS AS WELL AS ANALYSIS OF A SUBSET OF OBSERVATIONS HAVE SHOWN THESE THEORIES TO INSUFFICIENTLY EXPLAIN THE PHYSICAL PROCESSES OCCURRING IN THESE REGIONS. IN ORDER TO BETTER DETERMINE THE MECHANISMS THAT SHAPE THE UPPER IONOSPHERE, LONG TERM OBSERVATIONS OF THIS REGION NEED TO BE EXAMINED. HERE WE PROPOSE TO SYSTEMATICALLY ANALYZE THE DATASETS FROM THREE INSTRUMENTS TO DETERMINE THE PROPERTIES AND OCCURRENCE RATE OF THE TOPSIDE BULGE FEATURE. CORRELATIONS BETWEEN OBSERVED PROPERTIES AND LOCAL AS WELL AS SOLAR CONDITIONS WILL BE EXAMINED. RESULTS FROM PROCESSING EACH DATASET USED IN THIS PROJECT WILL BE COMPARED FOR POSSIBLE INFLUENCES OF OBSERVATION TECHNIQUES. FINALLY, A COMPELLING POTENTIAL MECHANISM FOR GENERATING THE TOPSIDE BULGE FEATURE WILL BE MODELED, AND THE RESULTS USED TO INTERPRET THE DERIVED CHARACTERISTICS OF THE TOPSIDE IONOSPHERE. THE RESULTS OF THIS PROJECT WILL CLARIFY THE PRESENTLY AMBIGUOUS PICTURE OF THE PHYSICAL PROCESSES THAT CONTROL THE TOPSIDE IONOSPHERE OF MARS AND WILL AID IN THEORETICAL PREDICTIONS FOR CLIMATE EVOLUTION AND ESCAPE AS WELL AS IN INTERPRETATIONS OF THE MARS ATMOSPHERE AND VOLATILE EVOLUTION (MAVEN) MISSION MEASUREMENTS.
doc.MajorAgency: CHARACTERIZING THE TOPSIDE BULGE IN THE IONOSPHERE
doc.MajorFundingAgency: CHARACTERIZING THE TOPSIDE BULGE IN THE IONOSPHERE

doc.ContractDescription: FOR THE TERRESTRIAL ECOSYSTEMS COMPONENT OF THE UPCOMING DESDYNI-R MISSION, NEW CHALLENGES HAVE EMERGED RELATED TO HOW TO MAKE BEST USE OF THE MISSION TO MEET THE NEEDS OF TERRESTRIAL ECOLOGY AND ECOSYSTEMS COMMUNITY WITHIN THE CONSTRAINTS OF THE REDUCED MISSIONS CAPABILITIES AND COST LIMITATIONS. PRIMARY AMONG THE EFFECTS OF THE ELIMINATION OF THE LIDAR COMPONENT FOR THE MISSION IS THE INCREASED DIFFICULTY IN ASSESSING FOREST STRUCTURAL PARAMETERS, SUCH AS STAND HEIGHT, DENSITY AND BIOMASS, WHICH PUTS AN ADDED EMPHASIS ON COMPARATIVE APPLICATIONS IN TERRESTRIAL ECOLOGY, SUCH AS CHANGE DETECTION, SEGMENTATION AND CLASSIFICATION. THE CHANGE IN MISSION CAPABILITY ALSO CREATES AN INCREASED SCRUTINY ON THE ACCURACY OF EXISTING RADAR-ONLY METHODS WHICH RELATE BACKSCATTER POWER AND POLARIMETRIC PRODUCTS TO FOREST BIOMASS IN THE OVERALL SYSTEM FORMULATION.THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO MAKE A STRONG CASE FOR THE MEMBERSHIP OF THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR, PROF. PAUL SIQUEIRA, TO BECOME PART OF TERRESTRIAL ECOLOGY COMPONENT OF THE DESDYNI-R SCIENCE DEFINITION TEAM (SDT). THE BASIS FOR THIS PARTICIPATION REQUEST IS FOUNDED ON THE PROPOSER'S BACKGROUND IN RADAR SYSTEMS ENGINEERING, SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR (SAR) AND INTERFEROMETRIC SAR (INSAR) PROCESSING AND ALGORITHM DEVELOPMENT, AND THE APPLICATION OF THESE REMOTE SENSING TECHNOLOGIES TO APPLICATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH NASAS TERRESTRIAL ECOLOGY PROGRAM.THIS PROPOSAL PROVIDES A BRIEF REVIEW OF THE PROJECT'S RELEVANCE TO NASA'S STRATEGIC GOALS FOR EARTH SCIENCES, A DETAILED SUMMARY OF THIS PROJECT'S GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, AND THEN A TECHNICAL PLAN THAT DESCRIBES THE PI'S SPECIFIC EXPERTISE AND HOW IT APPLIES TO THE UPCOMING NEEDS OF DESDYNI-R'S SCIENCE DEFINITION TEAM.
doc.MajorAgency: PARTICIPATION IN THE NASA SCIENCE DEFINITION TEAM
doc.MajorFundingAgency: PARTICIPATION IN THE NASA SCIENCE DEFINITION TEAM

doc.ContractDescription: THE PRIMARY MECHANISM BELIEVED TO HAVE SHAPED BOTH THE KUIPER AND ASTEROID BELTS BETWEEN THE ASTEROIDS' AND KUIPER BELT OBJECTS' (KBOS') INITIAL FORMATION AND TODAY IS THE COLLISIONAL CASCADE. HOWEVER, MANY QUESTIONS ABOUT THE BELTS' EVOLUTION REMAIN UNANSWERED OR CONTROVERSIAL, INCLUDING: 1) DID OUR SOLAR SYSTEM EVER APPEAR AS DUSTY AS THE EXTRASOLAR DEBRIS DISKS WE OBSERVE? IF SO, HOW AND TO WHERE DID THE LARGE AMOUNTS OF DUST GENERATED IN THE CASCADES DISAPPEAR? 2) HOW EXACTLY DID THE ASTEROID AND KUIPER BELTS' EVOLUTION PROCEED AS THE GIANT PLANETS FORMED AND BEGAN TO STIR THEM GRAVITATIONALLY? WE PROPOSE TO STUDY THESE QUESTIONS BY EXTENDING THE THEORY OF COLLISIONAL CASCADES TO INCLUDE THE COLLIDING BODIES' VELOCITY EVOLUTION SELF-CONSISTENTLY WITH THEIR SIZE EVOLUTION, USING BOTH ANALYTIC AND NUMERICAL TECHNIQUES TO INCORPORATE VELOCITY EVOLUTION VIA VISCOUS STIRRING, COLLISIONAL DAMPING, DYNAMICAL FRICTION, AND RADIATION PRESSURE INTO THE CALCULATION OF COLLISION RATES AND DUST PRODUCTION RATES. WE WILL THEN APPLY THIS NEW UNDERSTANDING TO FOLLOW THE ASTEROID AND KUIPER BELTS' EARLY HISTORIES.
doc.MajorAgency: INVESTIGATING THE HISTORY OF DESTRUCTIVE COLLISION
doc.MajorFundingAgency: INVESTIGATING THE HISTORY OF DESTRUCTIVE COLLISION

doc.ContractDescription: EXPERT WITNESS - GEOGRAPHY AND ANTHROPOLOGY/ENVIRONMENT AND NATURAL RESOURCES - ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE ASSESSMENT - IGF::CT::IGF

INTEGRATING INFERENCE AND COMPLEX EVENT PROCESSING FOR RFID-BASED LOGISTICS MANAGEMENT RFID IS A PROMISING ELECTRONIC IDENTIFICATION TECHNOLOGY THAT ENABLES A REAL-TIME INFORMATION INFRASTRUCTURE TO PROVIDE TIMELY, HIGHVALUE CONTENT TO MONITORING AND TRACKING APPLICATIONS. A PARTICULAR USAGE SCENARIO OF RFID TECHNOLOGY IS IN LOGISTICS MANAGEMENT AND SPECIFICALLY TO TRACK OBJECTS AS THEY ENTER, LEAVE OR MOVE THROUGH THE ENVIRONMENT SUCH AS THE ISS. WE PROPOSE A PROJECT TO DEMONSTRATE THE TECHNICAL FEASIBILITY OF EMPLOYING COMPLEX EVENT PROCESSING TECHNIQUE FOR TRACKING AND INFERRING THE LOCATIONS AND CONTAINMENT INFORMATION OF TAGGED OBJECTS IN ENVIRONMENTS SUCH AS THE ISS. OUR INNOVATION LIES IN THE USE OF COMPLEX EVENT PROCESSING TECHNIQUES TO PROCESS MULTIPLE RFID STREAMS AND THE USE OF INFERENCE METHODS ON THIS RAW, NOISY DATA STREAMS TO DERIVE LOCATION AND CONTAINMENT INFORMATION AND TO ANSWER QUERIES POSED ON THIS DATA. AN IMPORTANT CHALLENGE THAT WE WILL TACKLE IS TO SCALE THE TECHNIQUES TO A LARGE NUMBER OF CONCURRENT RFID READERS AND THEIR STREAM OF READINGS WHILE ALSO HANDLING TENS OR HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS OF RFID TAGGED OBJECTS. OUR PROPOSED WORK WILL LEVERAGE CORE ALGORITHMS FOR COMPLEX EVENT PROCESSING OF CONCURRENT RFID STREAMS AND FOR INFERRING LOCATION AND CONTAINMENT INFORMATION OF OBJECTS FROM THIS DATA THAT WE HAVE ALREADY DEVELOPED AS PART OF PRIOR RESEARCH; THESE ALGORITHMS HAVE BEEN EVALUATED USING A LABORATORY RFID SETUP AND USING SIMULATIONS. OUR PROPOSED WORK WILL FURTHER ENHANCE THESE ALGORITHMS FOR SPECIFIC USE CASE SCENARIOS FOR SPACE APPLICATIONS AND INCORPORATE THEM INTO A PROTOTYPE THAT IS CAPABLE OF OPERATING OVER TENS OF CONTINUOUS DATA STREAMS EMANATING FROM RFID READERS AND TRACK TENS OR HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS OF OBJECTS. OUR PROTOTYPE WILL SUPPORT A SIMPLE QUERY LANGUAGE FOR POSING QUERIES AND ALSO PROVIDE A USER INTERFACE FOR POSING SUCH QUERIES AND DISPLAYING RESULTS. OVERALL OUR DEMONSTRATION PROJECT WILL INVOLVE: (I) DESIGN OF A PROTOTYPE THAT INCORPORATES OUR INFERENCE AND COMPLEX EVENT PROCESSING TECHNIQUES, (II) USE OF TEST RFID DATA FROM NASA JSC OR THE ISS TO DEMONSTRATE THE FEASIBILITY AND SCALABILITY OF OUR TECHNIQUES IN A LABORATORY ENVIRONMENT, AND (III) COORDINATION WITH JSC TO CONFIGURE AND OPERATE OUR PROTOTYPE WITHIN THEIR EXPERIMENTAL CEP FACILITY. RELEVANCE AND IMPACT: RFID TECHNOLOGY HAS STRONG RELEVANCE TO SPACE APPLICATIONS. INTELLIGENT RFID INFERENCE AND COMPLEX EVENT PROCESSING CAN AUTOMATE TRACKING AND MONITORING QUERIES ---THE SYSTEM CAN ISSUE WARNINGS AUTOMATICALLY (WITHOUT REQUIRING CONSTANT CLOSE MONITORING BY LOGISTICS MANAGEMENT STAFF), AND TRIGGER PREVENTIVE ACTIONS TO MINIMIZE THE CHANCE OF HAZARDS OR THE IMPACT OF ANOMALIES. SUCH AUTOMATED TRACKING REDUCES THE CHANCES OF MISPLACING OBJECTS, ENABLES MISPLACED ITEMS TO BE FOUND QUICKLY, OR CAN EVEN PROVIDE ALERTS IF A TRACKED OBJECT GOES MISSING AND HAS NOT BEEN "SEEN" FOR A CERTAIN PERIOD OF TIME. BY ENHANCING LOGISTICS MANAGEMENT WITH AUTOMATION AND REAL-TIME OBJECT TRACKING AND ANOMALY DETECTION, THIS PROJECT IS DIRECTLY APPLICABLE TO FURTHERING THE GOALS OF SPACE EXPLORATION. THUS, THE OVERALL IMPACT OF OUR PROPOSED WORK IS TO DEMONSTRATE THE FEASIBILITY AND BENEFITS OF USING INFERENCE AND COMPLEX EVENT PROCESSING FOR RFID BASED LOGISTICS MANAGEMENT IN SPACE APPLICATIONS.

doc.MajorFundingAgency: INTEGRATING INFERENCE AND COMPLEX EVENT PROCESSING
